page.title: 10THROWLEY CHURCH GARDEN PARTY
page.content: The Throwley garden party is an annual event. It is held in the grounds of the Old Rectory, home of Mr & Mrs Peter Harris. Entrance is by a lucky number programme. There are stalls selling cakes,candyfloss,strawberries, ice cream, as well as home-made produce,plants, bric-a-brac and books. There are also games like coconut shie,bowling for a pig,bottle bonanza,ring-a-ding and croquet.Pony rides were available round the paddock and a 1937 Rolls Royce was on display. The garden party was opened by the vicar, Rev J.Russell. Events in the afternoon included Maypole Dancing by Throwley school and a tug of war. The event was to raise money for church funds. There was a private fancy dress party at the house in the evening.
